results.title: Schubert's 'Unfinished Symphony'
results.creator_credit: George Freedland, George Richfield and Official Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Musical masterpieces”.
The Radio Philharmonic Orchestra of Italy, under the baton of Fernando Previtali, performs the famous “Unfinished Symphony” of Schubert.

results.title: Schools working with curriculum frameworks
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces a panel including Dr. Max Stephens, Anne Gooding, Mary Weaven, Enid Mayfield, Geoff Whyte, Denis Cunningham and Geoff Burt who explain how the key ideas and issues of Curriculum Frameworks are being addressed by Schools. This panel of teachers and regional consultants discuss several specific frameworks areas.

results.title: Schools out
results.creator_credit: Alex Rappel, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Examines three innovative schools - Brinsley Road an annexe to Camberwell High school, Collingwood Community school, and Swinburne Community school. Students and teachers comment on the differences between these and traditional schools, and the relationships between pupils, teachers, and the community.

results.title: Schools of thought (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Focuses on the examples of Ansett Airlines and the Australian Taxation Office to look at contemporary management principles and theories that are often changed and integrated to suit the needs of companies in the 1990’s. This episode looks at different theories of the past and how they have been adapted for present day use.

results.title: Schools and school discipline. Tape 2.= Communication and motivation.
results.brief_description: Dr. William Glasser, founder of the Institute of Reality Therapy, discusses motivation in schools. Besides making sure that every student believes he or she has a chance in school, Dr. Glasser also stresses, through related examples, the inherent motivational qualities of courtesy and laughter, and the importance of communication with students through his use of classroom meetings.

results.title: Schoolboy father
results.creator_credit: Arthur Allan Seidelman, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Adaptation of the book “He’s my baby now” by Jeanette Eyerly, which focuses on a 16-year-old boy and his dilemma after learning that he has fathered a child. Determined to fill the parental void for his child, he finds himself confronting some harsh realities. Stars Rob Lowe and Dana Plato.

results.title: School support centres
results.creator_credit: Corporate Relations Unit, Western Metro Region and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Kevin Collins, Chief General Manager, Schools Division, describes the development and role of the School Support Centres and their aims and objectives in assisting the school community and teachers with a range of services and courses which will ultimately provide greater benefits to students. Features examples from a number of different School Support Centres.

results.title: School of Paris (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Artists at Work”.
Five contemporary artists at work in Paris: Dewasne, working in pure colours, primaries dominating, the work somewhere between music and architecture; Di Teana, at work in steel, winner of the Prix de Saint Goba, 1962; Fruhtrunk - bands orange to black, the colours play as a Bach fugue; Weisbuch - continues the Daumier tradition - and winner of the Prix de la Critique for the best show in Paris, 1961; and Hartung - one of the most important influences on abstract, and prize winner at the Venice Biennale, 1960.

results.title: School life in japan
results.brief_description: A survey of present day educational facilities for children in Japan, from pre-school to university. The film underlines the value which the Japanese place on a good educational system.
